snippet: The arrival of  King Abdullah II, coming three weeks after violent protests in Jordan over gas price increases, signaled an effort to maintain balance and stability in a region in turmoil.
abstract: King Abdullah II of Jordan becomes first head of state to visit West Bank since United Nations General Assembly upgraded status of Palestinians to nonmember observer state; visit is gesture of support that underlines importance of vote to Jordan and signals effort to maintain balance and stability in region in turmoil.
lead_paragraph: The arrival of  King Abdullah II, coming three weeks after violent protests in Jordan over gas price increases, signaled an effort to maintain balance and stability in a region in turmoil.

headline.seo: King Abdullah II of Jordan Visits West Bank to Show Support for U.N. Vote
headline.main: Visit to West Bank by King Gives Palestinians a Lift
headline.print_headline: Visit to West Bank by King Gives Palestinians a Lift
